[人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 利弗诺曼底绰号，快腿的或胆小的人，来源于古法语，含义是“野兔”(hare)

sentence.Network_en: An elevator mechanic can work the machinery directly by turning this lever.
sentence.Network_cn: 电梯修理工可以转动这根杠杆直接操作机器。

sentence.Network_en: Press the lever until you hear the catch engage.
sentence.Network_cn: 压下挡杆，直到听到挡挂好。

sentence.Network_en: I put the coin in the machine and pulled the lever.
sentence.Network_cn: 我把硬币投入机器，拉动控制杆。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French levier, leveor, from lever 'to lift'

entry.def: A lever is a handle or bar that is attached to a piece of machinery and which you push or pull in order to operate the machinery.

example.ex: Push the tiny lever on the lock...
The taps have a lever to control the mix of hot and cold water.
example.tran: 水阀上有一个手柄控制冷热水。

entry.def: A lever is a long bar, one end of which is placed under a heavy object so that when you press down on the other end you can move the object.
If you lever something in a particular direction, you move it there, especially by using a lot of effort.

example.ex: Neighbours eventually levered open the door with a crowbar...
example.tran: 邻居们最终用一根铁撬把门撬开了。

example.ex: Insert the fork about 6in. from the root and simultaneously lever it backwards...
example.tran: 将耙子插入到离根部约6英寸的地方并同时向后扳。

entry.tran: （用作施加压力等的）手段，方法
entry.def: A lever is an idea or action that you can use to make people do what you want them to do, rather than what they want to do.

example.ex: Radical, militant factions want to continue using the hostages as a lever to gain concessions from the west.
example.tran: 激进的好战派想要继续利用人质作筹码来换取西方的让步。

means.word_mean: 1. a rigid bar pivoted about a fulcrum
2. a simple machine that gives a mechanical advantage when given a fulcrum
3. a flat metal tumbler in a lever lock
1. to move or force, especially in an effort to get something open;

sentences.sentence: "The burglar jimmied the lock", "Raccoons managed to pry the lid off the garbage pail"

stems_affixes.value_cn: 不相干的,离题的,与……不相干
stems_affixes.word_buile: ir不+relevant[adj.有关的,中肯的,相应的,实质性的]→adj.不相干的,离题的,与……不相干

stems_affixes.value_cn: 有关的,中肯的,相应的,实质性的
stems_affixes.word_buile: re再+lev举起,变轻+ant……的→再举起→有关的
elevate[v.举起,提拔,振奋,提升……的职位]+or器→n.电梯,升降机
lev举起,变轻+er表名词→举起[重东西]的东西
lever[n.杆,杠杆,手段,途径,工具]+age状态→n.杠杆作用
lev举起,变轻+ity表名词→n.轻率,轻浮
lev举起,变轻+y→提升[税]:to raise tax
al一再+lev举起,变轻+iate表动词→不断轻→减轻

stems_affixes.value_cn: 举起,提拔,振奋,提升……的职位
stems_affixes.word_buile: e出+lev举起,变轻+ate表动词→举出→升高
lev举起,变轻+it+ate表动词→使东西举起→升到空中
lev举起,变轻+y→提升[税]:to raise tax

Sentence.sentence: If the light flashed on and off several times, the dolphins were supposed to press the left-hand lever followed by the right-hand one.
The levers and light were set up in exactly the same way except that this time it was only Doris who could see the light indicating which lever to press first

sentences.en: He is repairing the brake lever of an automobile.
sentences.cn: 他正在修理汽车的刹车杆。

sentences.en: They levered the iron into the house.
sentences.cn: 他们用杠子把铁块撬进屋里。

jushi.english: He is repairing the brake lever of an automobile.
jushi.chinese: 他正在修理汽车的刹车杆。

jushi.english: Push the lever and the machine will start.
jushi.chinese: 推动启动杆,机器就开动了。

jushi.english: They used the threat of strike action as a lever to get the employers to agree to their demands.
jushi.chinese: 他们以罢工威胁为手段,要求雇主同意他们的要求。
